channel.title: Scar divi help
channel.description: ok i got the newest ver. of scar divi, and i did the file-menu download srl. so i got the newest ver. of that also. But when i went to run a script it gave me an error just like it would if you hadn't had srl installed. so could somebody in detail explain to me what i'm missing. i'm sure i did something wrong with the srl. thanks, -fat mustard

item.title: Scar divi help
item.dc:creator: @mjordan mjordan
item.description:
@mjordan wrote:

[quote=“fat mustard, post:5, topic:119913”]idk sorry i didn’t read it right lol. here’s the error. Line 2030: [Error] (17359:51212): Unknown Identifier ‘randomclickevery’ in script C:\Program Files\SCAR 3.0\Scripts\MGS

Why does it say scar 3.0? i have 3.06[/quote]Thats an old script, and you need to use SRL 3.6 to run that.

Read full topic

item.title: Scar divi help
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

What script are you using? Maybe they forgot to include SRL into it. Also, I think the procedure is ‘RandomRClickEvery’, or at least thats the only one I’ve used; Its in the xAntiBan.scar

Read full topic

item.title: Scar divi help

item.description:
@fat_mustard wrote:

idk sorry i didn’t read it right lol. here’s the error. Line 2030: [Error] (17359:51212): Unknown Identifier ‘randomclickevery’ in script C:\Program Files\SCAR 3.0\Scripts\MGS

Why does it say scar 3.0? i have 3.06

item.title: Scar divi help
item.dc:creator: @mjordan mjordan
item.description:
@mjordan wrote:

There is no possible way we can help you if you don’t tell us the error.
So post the error from the debug and I’ll be more than happy to help you.

Also, what does posting the error have to do with it not being your script???

Read full topic

item.title: Scar divi help
item.dc:creator: @fat_mustard fat mustard
item.description:
@fat_mustard wrote:

it’s not my script so

Read full topic

item.title: Scar divi help
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

It would help if you explained or quoted the error you are getting. Most likely it is something you didn’t do correctly within the script.

Read full topic
